In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function in Julia that wraps text to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    curr_line = ""
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(curr_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= curr_line * "\n"
            curr_line = word
        else 
            if curr_line != ""
                curr_line *= " " * word
            else
                curr_line = word
            end
        end
    end
    result *= curr_line
    println(result)
end
```

Here is an example of using it:

```julia 
text = "This is a test string that will wrap across multiple lines"
wrap_string(text)
```

This would output:

```
This is a 
test string 
that will 
wrap across 
multiple 
lines
```

The key aspects:

- Split text into words 
- Keep track of current line length
- Check if adding next word exceeds text width
- If so, add current line and reset
- Otherwise add next word 
- Print out final result
